page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Earliest evidence of habitation are mesolithic and neolithic implements found in local fields. Neolithic and bronze age barrows are found on Old Winchester Hill which was used in the iron age as a hill fort. Celtic fields are found in the Stocks farm region. Grid ref.641 201. A Roman building is being excavated on Shavards Farm. grid ref.2579 211. A saxon settlement is also being excavated on the same farm about 800 metres from the Saxon Church of Corhampton. The Manor of Meonstoke was mentioned in the Domesday Book. It has continued as a farming community to this day. A major event was a fire in 1719 which destroyed most of Meonstoke High Street.
